name: repetition
description: Rewords/paraphrases/repeats previously provided information and thus, should not move posteriors.

gd_0.interviewer_turn: Can you quickly give me a run-down of your recent experience - super brief.
gd_0.applicant_turn: So I was a senior graphic designer in my last role and had several responsibilities including designing marketing collateral, centralising brand elements for consistency, as well as various different rebranding projects.

gd_1.interviewer_turn: What previous positions have you held that are relevant to this job?
gd_1.applicant_turn: I've worked as a graphic designer for a couple of years now including in a freelancer capacity, teaching me how to be independent.

gd_2.interviewer_turn: Social media is key nowadays. How do you handle design for social media?
gd_2.applicant_turn: I like to tailor assets based on how they will be seen (i.e. who, where and how?) and play with motion.

gd_3.interviewer_turn: Can you briefly summarize your background and experience?
gd_3.applicant_turn: I have a B.S. in Visual Communication Design and experience as a virtual retail specialist and apprentice graphic designer, focusing on customer support, design assistance, branding, and print deliverables.

gd_4.interviewer_turn: What kinds of design work have you done in your recent roles?
gd_4.applicant_turn: I've worked as a freelance and in-house graphic designer creating branding, presentations, reports, social media graphics, marketing campaigns, packaging, and print materials, while managing multiple projects and collaborating with remote and cross-functional teams.

gd_5.interviewer_turn: What did you do as a Junior 3D Artist at Wirestock?
gd_5.applicant_turn: I created a base 3D render, produced sequential renders with incremental visual changes, preserved previous edits at each stage, and combined all modifications into a final polished render.

gd_6.interviewer_turn: What have you worked on in your last roles?
gd_6.applicant_turn: My current employer is in the medical industry and so I've helped out across social media, web-design and physical print-out materials.

gd_7.interviewer_turn: What sort of design experience do you have?
gd_7.applicant_turn: I have design experience that includes both print, digital, social media and other assets for B2B as well as for myself as an influencer.

gd_8.interviewer_turn: What was a big achievement in your last position?
gd_8.applicant_turn: By focusing on centralising and standardising our messaging and communications, I grew student engagement by 50%.

gd_9.interviewer_turn: Would you say your experience is mainly within the same vertical or quite spread?
gd_9.applicant_turn: I have diverse experience across domains involving many aspects of graphic design like marketing and social media.

ml_0.applicant_turn: I have two actually. The first was a p project using YOLO that scored an incredibly high mAP and the second was achieving an order of magnitude increase in automatic image annotation.

ml_1.interviewer_turn: Describe a time where you were responsible for data collection.
ml_1.applicant_turn: One time I used a drone to collect data of a forest for downstream purposes such as wildfire prediction.

ml_2.interviewer_turn: Describe an experience where you used Python?
ml_2.applicant_turn: Using software design principles and IO I created a quiz program.

ml_3.interviewer_turn: That chatbot seems interesting. So it had much of an impact?
ml_3.applicant_turn: Yes it reduced SME workload by nearly an order of magnitude by automatically producing key dashboards.

ml_4.interviewer_turn: Your BERT based sentiment detector. Talk me through that?
ml_4.applicant_turn: Basically, we were able to predict rude retailers with 93% accuracy to massivley reduce complains and boosting revenue..

ml_5.interviewer_turn: Looking back at your previous work experience, what really stands out?
ml_5.applicant_turn: I feel like my biggest impact was as a grad researcher where we looked at dynamic model architecture. As part of that role I also got lots of experience working in an HPC environment and training large models.

ml_6.interviewer_turn: What's a time where you dealt with a massive dataset?
ml_6.applicant_turn: Would have been the mobile network optimisation project where there were tens of millions of data points and we aimed to identify network bottlenecks.

ml_7.interviewer_turn: Tell me about a time when your work moved a needle the most - what do you hang your hat on?
ml_7.applicant_turn: 100% my RA gig where we reduced execution time 8-fold using deep learning for feature selection.

ml_8.interviewer_turn: Outside of work, what are you most proud of?
ml_8.applicant_turn: Definitely my uni scholarship. I know it's still related to my degree but that took some real effort outside of usual studying.

ml_9.interviewer_turn: What was the hardest project you have worked on would you say?
ml_9.applicant_turn: Probably my forex trader because time-series forecasting (especially with highly stochastic signal like price data) is naturally difficult.

sales_0.interviewer_turn: Can you walk me through a time where you had to take an existing system and improve it?
sales_0.applicant_turn: Sure, in my current role I took an old Salesforce procedure and improved it, slashing data entry cost and optimising based on feedback.

sales_1.interviewer_turn: I'd like to know what you get up to outside of work.
sales_1.applicant_turn: I love playing tennis and am a head coach. I also love investiment and run the investment club that has nearly 70 members.

sales_2.interviewer_turn: What skills did you develop as a property manager?
sales_2.applicant_turn: I was mainly charged with ensuring high occupancy rate through excellent administration, communication and customer service.

sales_3.interviewer_turn: Do you have any educational experience that you believe is relevant to sales?
sales_3.applicant_turn: Yes, I learned a lot through my business degree which also focused on marketing that is relevant to sales in my opinion.

sales_4.interviewer_turn: Give me an example of where you had to work in a corss functional team?
sales_4.applicant_turn: Sure, there have been many times where the business needed to align on geographic strategy with external affairs, legal, marketing and sales.

sales_5.interviewer_turn: Do you only have experience working in large companies?
sales_5.applicant_turn: No I was actually a sales manager of a startup many years ago - boosting sales by 30%. I also had to maintain financial records etc.

sales_6.interviewer_turn: Are you able to demonstrate that your sales techniques actually drive commercial impact?
sales_6.applicant_turn: Definitely, I have recurring evidence of growing revenue. At my last company I even surpassed the FinOps forecast!

sales_7.applicant_turn: By  having great product knowledge, collaborating with team members and persuasive techniques.

sales_8.interviewer_turn: Do you prefer managing low or high value accounts? Do you have experience with both?
sales_8.applicant_turn: I believe I can drive larger impact when managing high value accounts. For example, working in tech I was able to find new sales opportunities with existing accounts and consistently surpassed targets.

sales_9.interviewer_turn: Talk me through your experience as a team lead.
sales_9.applicant_turn: I won several awards, achieved beyond annual quota across many complex sales cycles and optimised lead routing across 20 reps.
